snippet: The refugees, who had been stuck in a buffer zone along the Jordanian border for months, were granted entry, the United Nations refugee agency said.
abstract: United Nations refugee agency reports that Jordan is allowing hundreds of Syrian refugees, stranded for months in buffer zone along northern border, to enter country; it remains unclear how many newly admitted refugees will be allowed to remain in Jordan, with UN and Human Rights Watch reporting that number of refugees sent back to Syria by Jordan has been rising in recent months.
lead_paragraph: The refugees, who had been stuck in a buffer zone along the Jordanian border for months, were granted entry, the United Nations refugee agency said.

headline.main: Syrian Refugees, Once Stuck, Enter Jordan
headline.print_headline: Syrian Refugees, Once Stuck, Enter Jordan
